document.discussion_title: Investment Analysts’ Recent Ratings Changes for Twitter (TWTR) - Watch List News
document.topic_text: Tweet Several brokerages have updated their recommendations and price targets on shares of Twitter (NYSE: TWTR) in the last few weeks: 8/10/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Vetr from a “strong-buy” rating to a “buy” rating. They now have a $21.24 price target on the stock. 8/9/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Jefferies Group. They now have a $23.00 price target on the stock. 8/4/2016 – Twitter had its “neutral” rating reaffirmed by analysts at SunTrust Banks Inc.. They now have a $18.00 price target on the stock. 7/31/2016 – Twitter had its “hold” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Wedbush. They now have a $14.00 price target on the stock, down previously from $20.00. 7/28/2016 – Twitter had its “hold” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Argus. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its price target lowered by analysts at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. from $22.00 to $21.00. They now have a “buy” rating on the stock. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its price target lowered by analysts at Mizuho from $16.00 to $15.00. They now have a “neutral” rating on the stock. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its price target lowered by analysts at Nomura from $16.00 to $13.00. They now have a “neutral” rating on the stock. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its price target lowered by analysts at Royal Bank Of Canada from $20.00 to $17.00. They now have a “sector perform” rating on the stock. 7/27/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Axiom Securities from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating. They now have a $16.00 price target on the stock, down previously from $18.00. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its price target lowered by analysts at Stifel Nicolaus from $10.00 to $9.00. They now have a “sell” rating on the stock. 7/27/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Canaccord Genuity from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating. They now have a $16.00 price target on the stock, down previously from $20.00. 7/27/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Cantor Fitzgerald from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its “market perform” rating reaffirmed by analysts at BMO Capital Markets. They now have a $18.00 price target on the stock. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its “neutral” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Robert W. Baird. They now have a $16.00 price target on the stock. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its “neutral” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Macquarie. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its “hold” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Pacific Crest. 7/27/2016 – Twitter had its price target lowered by analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co. from $18.00 to $16.00. They now have a “neutral” rating on the stock. 7/26/2016 – Twitter had its “neutral” rating reaffirmed by analysts at MKM Partners. They now have a $14.00 price target on the stock. 7/26/2016 – Twitter had its “sector perform” rating reaffirmed by analysts at RBC Capital Markets. They now have a $20.00 price target on the stock. 7/26/2016 – Twitter had its “underweight” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Morgan Stanley. They now have a $13.25 price target on the stock. 7/26/2016 – Twitter had its “neutral” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Citigroup Inc.. They now have a $16.00 price target on the stock. 7/25/2016 – Twitter had its “neutral” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Wedbush. They now have a $14.00 price target on the stock, down previously from $20.00. 7/25/2016 – Twitter is now covered by analysts at Evercore ISI. They set a “hold” rating and a $18.00 price target on the stock. 7/24/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Canaccord Genuity. They now have a $20.00 price target on the stock. 7/23/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Raymond James Financial Inc. from an “outperform” rating to a “mkt perform” rating. 7/22/2016 – Twitter had its “market perform” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Raymond James Financial Inc.. They now have a $39.00 price target on the stock. 7/21/2016 – Twitter was upgraded by analysts at Vetr from a “buy” rating to a “strong-buy” rating. They now have a $21.14 price target on the stock. 7/20/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Zacks Investment Research from a “hold” rating to a “sell” rating. According to Zacks, “Twitter is struggling to expand its user base. Its once reliable ad business is also showing signs of a slowdown after Twitter said that “brand marketers did not increase spend as quickly as expected in the first quarter.” The company has been taking up several measures to attract more users and revenues. The company has recently signed steaming deals with CBS and Bloomberg and is reportedly holding talks with sports leagues like NBA to acquire sports related content. Earlier on, it had won rights to stream NFL. We continue to believe that Twitter’s ability to attract users and grow advertising revenues amid significant competition will be a key factor determining its growth, considering the fact that investments in product development need to continue. Estimates have been stable lately ahead of the company’s second quarter earnings release. “ 7/19/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Deutsche Bank AG. They now have a $23.00 price target on the stock. 7/18/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Vetr from a “strong-buy” rating to a “buy” rating. They now have a $20.52 price target on the stock. 7/18/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Jefferies Group. 7/13/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Zacks Investment Research from a “hold” rating to a “sell” rating. According to Zacks, “Twitter is struggling to expand its user base. Its once reliable ad business is also showing signs of a slowdown after Twitter said that “brand marketers did not increase spend as quickly as expected in the first quarter.” The company has been taking up several measures to attract more users and revenues. The company has recently signed steaming deals with CBS and Bloomberg and is reportedly holding talks with sports leagues like NBA to acquire sports related content. Earlier on, it had won rights to stream NFL. We continue to believe that Twitter’s ability to attract users and grow advertising revenues amid significant competition will be a key factor determining its growth, considering the fact that investments in product development need to continue. Estimates have been stable lately ahead of the company’s second quarter earnings release. “ 7/12/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Pivotal Research. They now have a $26.00 price target on the stock, down previously from $27.00. 7/12/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.. They now have a $22.00 price target on the stock. 7/11/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at SunTrust Banks Inc. from a “buy” rating to a “neutral” rating. They now have a $18.00 price target on the stock. 7/11/2016 – Twitter was downgraded by analysts at Monness Crespi & Hardt from a “buy” rating to a “neutral” rating. 7/11/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Canaccord Genuity. They now have a $20.00 price target on the stock. 7/11/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Jefferies Group. 7/10/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Deutsche Bank AG. 7/10/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Cantor Fitzgerald. 7/6/2016 – Twitter had its “neutral” rating reaffirmed by analysts at SunTrust Banks Inc.. They now have a $18.00 price target on the stock. 6/30/2016 – Twitter had its “hold” rating reaffirmed by analysts at MKM Partners. They now have a $14.00 price target on the stock. 6/22/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at MKM Partners. 6/21/2016 – Twitter had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at SunTrust Banks Inc.. They now have a $18.00 price target on the stock. 6/14/2016 – Twitter had its “neutral” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Tigress Financial. Shares of Twitter Inc. ( NYSE:TWTR ) opened at 19.78 on Friday. Twitter Inc. has a 52-week low of $13.73 and a 52-week high of $31.87. The firm’s market capitalization is $13.85 billion. The company’s 50-day moving average price is $17.63 and its 200-day moving average price is $16.54. Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) last announced its earnings results on Tuesday, July 26th. The social networking company reported $0.13 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $0.10 by $0.03. The company earned $602 million during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $606.37 million. Twitter’s revenue for the quarter was up 19.9% on a year-over-year basis. During the same period in the previous year, the company posted $0.07 earnings per share. On average, equities research analysts expect that Twitter Inc. will post $0.51 EPS for the current fiscal year. In related news, insider Adam Messinger sold 52,914 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction on Monday, August 1st. The shares were sold at an average price of $16.76, for a total value of $886,838.64. The sale was disclosed in a document filed with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which can be accessed through this hyperlink . Also, CAO Robert Kaiden sold 11,754 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction on Wednesday, June 1st. The stock was sold at an average price of $15.02, for a total transaction of $176,545.08. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Twitter, Inc (Twitter) offers products and services for users, advertisers, developers and platform and data partners. The Company’s service is live-live commentary, live connections, live conversations. Its products and services for users include Twitter, and Periscope and Vine. Its Twitter is a platform for public self-expression and conversation in real time. Receive News & Ratings for Twitter Inc Daily - Enter your email address below to receive a concise daily summary of the latest news and analysts' ratings for Twitter Inc and related companies with Analyst Ratings Network's FREE daily email newsletter . Comment on this Post
